1.text: Place all the tiles facedown on a flat surface.

2.text: Each person takes a set amount of tiles, depending on the number of players.

3.text: Start the game by saying "split" and flipping over your tiles.

4.text: Arrange your tiles into words that intersect like a crossword.

5.text: Exchange 1 letter tile for 3 new ones if you’re having trouble using it.

6.text: Say “peel” once you have used all your tiles.

7.text: Incorporate the new tile into your grid of words.

8.text: Continue peeling until the bunch has fewer tiles than the number of players.

9.text: Yell “bananas” if you are the first player to use up all your tiles.

10.text: Inspect the winning grid for disqualifying words.

11.text: Play with no peeling or dumping for a slower-paced version of the game.

12.text: Do not allow peeling for a very quick version of the game.

13.text: Try a solitaire version of Bananagrams to hone your skills.

14.text: Play cooperatively to develop concentration and reading ability.
